title: Short-Intensive Case-Based Teaching and Learning (CBTL) Course for Improving Clinical Reasoning in Dentistry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic dental science knowledge (oral anatomy, pathology, etc.) and understanding of fundamental clinical procedures
context.additional_context: Providing personalized feedback through individual learning data analysis, emphasizing problem-solving activities based on real clinical cases

learning_goals: Learners can apply 3+ clinical reasoning strategies (e.g., hypothesis-deductive reasoning) in diagnosing complex dental cases
Learners can analyze case-based scenarios to present treatment plans step-by-step with scientific rationale
Learners can revise and refine their clinical reasoning processes 2+ times based on peer assessment and instructor feedback

resources: BYOD-Based Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
